intro: Metastelma mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican ghostflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branched. Metastelma mexicanum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
